item.title: Lauren Chan on modeling, her new plus-size luxury clothing brand, and leaning into what makes you unique.
item.itunes:title: Lauren Chan on modeling, her new plus-size luxury clothing brand, and leaning into what makes you unique.
item.description:
Today we are joined by Lauren Chan, the founder and CEO of Henning, a newly launched luxury plus-size clothing brand. We’re completely in love with this brand and all its thoughtful details! We’re also obsessed with Lauren, TBH. She gives us a peek into her experiences as both a plus-size model and fashion editor for Glamour Magazine. We get her insight into how the plus-size modeling landscape has changed over the years and how modeling has affected her relationship with her body. Maybe most interesting, she pulls back the curtain on all the retouching (and padding!) that goes on behind the scenes. We’re shook! We also chat about her experience starting her own business (without any outside funding!), and the lessons she’s learned along the way.

 

Products, places, and links mentioned:

 

  • Check out Henning here. You can also take 15% off with code badonpaper15.
  • Follow Lauren at @lcchan and Henning at @henning
  • We had our celebratory pod dinner at Gramercy Tavern
  • We stayed at The Statler hotel in Dallas (and loved it!)

 

Lauren’s Skincare Routine:

  • Dermalogica Cleanser
  • Drunk Elephant Vitamin C Serum
  • Supergoop Sunscreen
  • Dr. Bronner Face Cream
  • Korres Overnight Facial
  • Fresh Black Tea Eye Cream

 

Lauren’s Makeup Routine:

  • Nars Creamy Concealer
  • Benefit Goof-proof Eyebrow Pencil
  • MAC Lipstick in Velvet Teddy
  • Clinique Mascara

 

Obsessions:

  • Sarah Flint Perfect Bootie 70mm heel (BOP45 for $45 off)
  • The Body Stone

 

Instagram Obsessions:

  • @sarahfcarter
  • @_hellostella_

 

Books Mentioned:

  • We Came Here to Forget by Andrea Dunlop (November Book Club Pick!)
  • Modern Love edited by Daniel Jones
  • Such a Fun Age by Kiley Reid
  • Throne of Glass Series by Sarah J Maas

 

Sponsors: 

 

  • Night Pillow: Go to discovernight.com and get 20% off with code BOP20 at checkout.

item.title: Personality Tests! A deep dive into the 5 love languages, The Enneagram, + Myers Briggs
item.itunes:title: Personality Tests! A deep dive into the 5 love languages, The Enneagram, + Myers & Briggs
item.description:
We don’t know about you but we are both personality test obsessed. Today we’re taking a look at three of our favorites: the 5 love languages, the Enneagram, and Myers Briggs. Every personality has its good and its bad, and we are both very cool with both sides of our own (thankfully!) If you ever think that Becca is roasting Grace, don’t worry - that is how she shows love. We also break down introverts vs. extroverts. Grace gets on her soapbox: Just because you’re introverted doesn’t mean you’re shy! We have a ton in common personality - wise, but when we differ, we definitely DIFFER! Take the quizzes yourself and see what we all have in common, and then come about them with us in the facebook group!

Quizzes Mentioned:

  • The 5 Love Languages - Take the test!
  • Enneagrams - Take the test!
  • Myers & Briggs - 16 Personalities: Take the test!

 Podcast Mentioned:

  • Selfie 

Obsessions:

  • Garlic Short Rib Recipe by Alison Roman
  • Modern Love  - Amazon Prime
  • Kosas - lip oils - sephora

  • @the_spines

item.title: Eva Chen on writing children’s books, meeting Oprah, and why “balance” is a myth (and that’s okay)!
item.description:
Today we are joined by Eva Chen! Eva probably needs no introduction but she’s the Director of Fashion Partnerships at Instagram. What you may not know is that she’s also a children’s book author and the self proclaimed “Walter White of vintage Chanel jackets!” Eva talks about everything from changing careers, meeting your heroes IRL (Oprah!!), getting a book deal, and following your dreams. She also gets vulnerable, talking about what it’s like to worry that people won’t like her work. We round out the episode with all of Eva’s favorites: up & coming fashion designers, beauty obsessions (a very fancy face roller), a fancy hotel, and of course — YA novels.

 

Designers Mentioned: 

  • Pyer Moss
  • Rejina Pyo
  • Ganni
  • 16 Arlington
  • Lesyanebo
  • Racil
  • Contro collection
  • Net-a-Porter Premier

 

Products Mentioned:

  • Elemis Pro-Collagen Cleansing Balm
  • Augustinus Bader
  • Refa Face Roller
  • Joanna Czech Facials
  • Elaine Huntzinger  Facial

 

Obsessions:

  • Glow Bar 
  • Horoscope necklaces at Candyshop Vintage

 

Instagram Obsessions:

  • @Benlenovitz
  • @rachelista

 

For more Eva on Instagram:

  • @evachen212
  • @tbannister 

 

Books Mentioned:

  • Get a life Chloe Brown by Talia Hibbert
  • We Came Here to Forget by Andrea Dunlop (November Book Club Pick!)
  • Throne of Glass Series by Sarah Maas
  • 6 of Crows by Leigh Bardugo
  • Save Me the Plums by Ruth Reichl
  • The Queen of the Tearling Trilogy by Erika Johansen
  • The Selection by Kiera Cass

 

Eva’s Books:

  • Juno Valentine and the Magical Shoes by Eva Chen
  • A is for Awesome by Eva Chen
  • Juno Valentine and the Fabulous Fashion Adventure by Eva Chen 

 

Hotels Mentioned:

item.title: Carly the Prepster: Unfiltered. Carly answers ALL your questions.
item.itunes:title: Carly the Prepster: Unfiltered. Carly answers ALL your questions.
item.description:
“We have all sent a DM we regret” - Carly Heitlinger, carlytheprepster.com

 

Our friend Carly drops in for a bonus episode  to answer literally every single one of your questions! She puts it all out there, the good, bad, and the ugly. She lets us in on the biggest misconceptions about her (She is not as outgoing as you may think, and she doesn’t share everything!), how she navigates being introverted, dealing with anxiety, and her thoughts on online snark forums. We also talk about breakups, sex, hair bows, and more! Lastly, she shares her advice for cutting the cord when a relationship is over - and how to get your control back!

 

Products Mentioned:

Awesome Etiquette Podcast

Coffee Break French Podcast

Blue Bistro (hulu series)

 

Books Mentioned:

Babysitters Club Series by Ann M. Martin

Boys in the Boat by  Daniel James Brown

Harry Potter Series by JK Rowling

The Magicians by Lev Grossman

Little Fires Everywhere by Celeste Ng

Elin Hilderbrand’s Books

How Could She by Lauren Mechling

Bad Blood by John Carryrou

Quiet by Susan Cain

 

Audio Books Mentioned:

Daisy Jones and The Six by Taylor Jenkins Reid

The Dutch House by Ann Patchett (Tom Hanks narrates!)

Save me The Plums by Ruth Reichl

 

Sponsors:

item.itunes:title: How Could She by Lauren Mechling w/ Special Guest Carly Heitlinger
item.description:
Our October Book Club pick is How Could She by Lauren Mechling, and we are joined by friend of the pod, Carly Heitlinger (Carly the Prepster)! The three of us explore the complexities of female friendship in your 30’s, the book’s 3 central characters, and who we most identify with. Although not all of us loved this book completely, we definitely have a lot to say about it!

item.title: Cindy Crawford shares her supermodel secrets + takes us inside the modeling biz!
item.itunes:title: Cindy Crawford shares her supermodel secrets + takes us inside the modeling biz!
item.description:
Today’s guest needs no introduction… it’s Cindy Crawford! Besides being Grace’s dream guest, Cindy is also an absolute expert when it comes to skincare. She talks about growing up in the midwest, an early mean girls experience, and of course: her modeling career. She also let us peek behind the curtain and learn how she started her own skincare line, all the way down to the chemistry! She also tells us her favorite fashion trends, products… even her work out routine. She also lets us in on a few model secrets (her swap for soy sauce, her cocktail of choice). Cindy talks about balance, self care, and motherhood. We found Cindy’s life fascinating and didn’t think this was possible but somehow love her even more than before! 

Products mentioned

  • Meaningful beauty - Cindy’s beauty line (also available at Ulta)
    • Intensive Triple Exfoliating Treatment
    • Anti-Aging Day Cream
    • Age Recovery Night Cream
    • Youth Activating Melon Serum
    • Firming & Tightening Body Hydration Treatment
    • Lifting Eye Cream
    • Revive & Brighten Eye Masque
  • Amazon Ice Roller 
  • Veronica Beard Blazers
  • Sarah Flint Perfect Pumps
  • Sarah Flint Flats
  • Sarah Flint Marina Boot

item.content:encoded:
Today’s guest needs no introduction… it’s Cindy Crawford! Besides being Grace’s dream guest, Cindy is also an absolute expert when it comes to skincare. She talks about growing up in the midwest, an early mean girls experience, and of course: her modeling career. She also let us peek behind the curtain and learn how she started her own skincare line, all the way down to the chemistry! She also tells us her favorite fashion trends, products… even her work out routine. She also lets us in on a few model secrets (her swap for soy sauce, her cocktail of choice). Cindy talks about balance, self care, and motherhood. We found Cindy’s life fascinating and didn’t think this was possible but somehow love her even more than before! 

Products mentioned

  • Meaningful beauty - Cindy’s beauty line (also available at Ulta)
    • Intensive Triple Exfoliating Treatment
    • Anti-Aging Day Cream
    • Age Recovery Night Cream
    • Youth Activating Melon Serum
    • Firming & Tightening Body Hydration Treatment
    • Lifting Eye Cream
    • Revive & Brighten Eye Masque
  • Amazon Ice Roller 
  • Veronica Beard Blazers
  • Sarah Flint Perfect Pumps
  • Sarah Flint Flats
  • Sarah Flint Marina Boot
  • Cindy’s fave jeans: Redone, Frame, AG, Page, Citizens of Humanity, Midheaven
  • Nicola Bathie Earrings

Books:

  • A Little Life by Hana Yanagihara
  • Educated by Tara Westover
  • Maybe You Should Talk to Someone by Lori Gottlieb
  • I’ll Never Tell by Catherine Mackenzie
  • The Flatshare by Beth O’Leary
  • The Gifted School by Bruce Holsinger
  • How Could She by Lauren Mechling (October Book Club!)

TV Shows:

  • Euphoria on HBO
  • Modern Love on Amazon
  • Succession on NetFlix

Instagram Obsession:

  • @swissmiss
  • @verryrobin_co

item.title: Travel Routines, Tricks, Recs, and Some Very Strong Opinions!
item.description:
We have been traveling quite a bit for our live shows and more, so we thought it was time to share some of our vastly differing opinions when it comes to travel. We talk about hotels, airplanes, beauty routines, packing, planning, and everything in between. Needless to say, we have some differing views on a lot of things! Today, in addition to hopefully amusing you with our strong opinions, we help you navigate some of the more stressful parts of traveling through our own experiences. (And did you know customs has an app?) We share all the things we do to keep organized (and sane!) when it comes to traveling.

Things Mentioned:

  • Aaptiv App
  • New York Times: 36 hours series
  • TSA Pre-Check
  • The Points Guy

Hotels Mentioned:

  • The Beverly Hills Hotel in Los Angeles
  • The Ritz Carlton
  • Brown’s Hotel in London
  • The Breakers in Palm Beach
  • La Sultana in Morocco
  • Hotel du-cap-eden-roc in France
  • The Statler Dallas

Products Mentioned:

  • Pregnancy Pillow from Amazon
  • Silk Pajamas from Karen Mabon
  • Cookware Set from Simply Calphalon
  • Tumi Suitcase
  • Away Suitcases

Instagram Obsessions:

  • @chloeiscrazy
  • @blonde_atlas
  • @bowenyang

Books Mentioned:

  • How Could She by Lauren Mechling (October book club pick)
  • The Flatshare by Beth O’Leary

 Sponsors: 

  • Borghese:  Special offer 25% sitewide borghese.com enter code BOP25 at checkout.
  • LOLA: You can 30% off your first month’s subscription with code BOP30 at www.mylola.com
  • Hello Fresh: For $80 off your first month hellofresh.com/BOP80 and enter code BOP80

Check out tickets to our Fall live shows in DC, Philly, Atlanta, New York City and Dallas.

item.title: Bad on Politics #2: Clare Malone Gives us a pre-Debate Primer!
item.itunes:title: Bad on Politics #2: Clare Malone Gives us a pre-debate Primer!
item.description:
Friend of the pod and political writer for FiveThirtyEight, Clare Malone joins us to help sort through the top ten Democratic candidates on stage at the next debate. She takes a deep dive into the backgrounds of the top three front runners (Joe Biden, Elizabeth Warren, Bernie Sanders), and gives us the headlines on the rest (Pete Buttigieg, Kamala Harris, Andrew Yang, Beto O’Rourke, Amy Klobuchar, Cory Booker, Julian Castro). Clare also breaks down the Republican challengers, too (Bill Weld, Joe Walsh, and Mark Sanford). 

 

For more Clare Malone:

@claremalone on instagram and twitter

https://fivethirtyeight.com/contributors/clare-malone/ on fivethirtyeight.com

 

 

About Bad on Politics: Bad on Politics is a monthly bonus episode where we invite a guest expert to help us break down a political topic. We get it, politics is confusing and there's a anxiety-inducing amount of news coverage to follow. So, we're here to ask the "dumb" questions so you don't have to. We want to break things down so you can understand what's going on and make an informed opinion.

item.title: Mollie Chen on changing careers, maintaining a balance, all things FOOD, and lazy girl skincare.
item.itunes:title: Mollie Chen on changing careers, maintaining a balance, all things FOOD, and lazy girl skincare.
item.description:
We are back from San Francisco and off to Philly + DC next week! This week we’re joined by our friend Mollie Chen! She’s a brand consultant (and one of the Co-Founders of Birchbox!), a beauty guru, a mom, and a serious foodie. We talk about everything from knowing when it’s time to change careers to skincare for lazy people to the perfect day of eating in NYC. She also shares some great advice for new moms and maintaining a balance in your life. 

Products Mentioned:

Pregnancy Pillow from Amazon

The Politician on Netflix

M.M. Lafleur trench coat

Philz Coffee

Garlic Press from Amazon

Mollie’s product recs (so many we made it it’s own doc!)

 

Instagram Obsessions:

@syattfitness

@palmbeachthrifters

 

Books Mentioned:

Fashion Climbing by Bill Cunningham

How Could She by Lauren Mechling (October book club pick)

With the Fire on High by Elizabeth Acevedo

The Poet X by Elizabeth Acebedo

The Flatshare by Beth O’Leary

Mollie’s Medium posts - Leaving a Company You Started and A Type-A Guide to Time Off

item.title: Graham Norton on Fanboy Moments, Best-Smelling Celebs, and Becoming a Novelist at 52
item.itunes:title: Graham Norton on Fanboy Moments, Best-Smelling Celebs, and Becoming a Novelist at 52
item.description:
This week, we are joined by Graham Norton, the beloved UK talk show host and author of a brand new novel! We talk to him about his show—everything from the funniest to the best-smelling guests and how he manages to get such good stories from his guests. Then we turn to his newest book, A Keeper. We couldn’t let him leave without a few grab bag questions too… so we also quizzed him on Dolly Parton, UK Drag Race, and more!

Outside of Graham, we talk about our tour (starts today in SF!), Grace’s birthday, and a new sleeping hack.

Products Mentioned:

  • Madewell hard sunglasses case (not available online)
  • Beauty Counter Blush in Nectar
  • Pregnancy Pillow from Amazon

 Instagram Obsessions:

  • @farmrio
  • @farrisdoesfaces

 Books Mentioned:

  • American Predator by Maureen Callahan
  • Obviously by Akilah Hughs
  • Anna K by Jenny Lee
  • Fashion Climbing by Bill Cunningham
  • Fleishman is in Trouble by Taffy Brodessser-Akner
  • The Girl Who Never Read Noam Chomsky by Jana Casale

item.title: Katharine McGee on the Behind the Scenes of American Royals and the Ins and Outs of the Publishing Industry
item.itunes:title: Katharine McGee on the Behind the Scenes of American Royals and the Ins and Outs of the Publishing Industry
item.description:
Katharine McGee, the author of our September Book Club Pick, American Royals joins us to talk about the making of the book. We chat about the long road to publishing, how to get a book deal, how books turn into TV shows and movies, and how the New York Times Best Seller list works—it’s not how you think! We learned so much from her on today’s episode and cannot wait for the sequel!

 

Books Mentioned:

The Royal We by Jessica Morgan & Heather Cocks

99 Glimpses of Princess Margaret by Craig Brown

The Royals by Kitty Kelley

Behind the Throne: A Domestic History of the British Royal Household by Adrian Tinniswood

Anna K - Jenny Lee (comes out next year)

 

Instagram:

@katharinemcgee

 

Check out tickets to our Fall live shows in San Francisco, DC, Philly, Atlanta, New York City and Dallas.

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more!

Follow us on Instagram @badonpaperpodcast. Follow Grace on Instagram @graceatwood and Becca @beccamfreeman.

item.title: American Royals Book Club + Everything Royal
item.itunes:title: American Royals Book Club + Everything Royal
item.description:
Our September Book Club is here and we are so excited to dig into Katharine McGee’s American Royals, but beware it’s sprinkled with spoilers! This book posits a world where George Washington was the first King of America rather than the first President. The story follows his descendant, Princess Beatrice and her dramatic road to the throne. We also talk about everything Royal from books, movies, weddings, and gossip, and what we have been reading (and what we are close to putting down!).

 

Products Mentioned:

  • Glow Bar - $65 30 minute facial
  • Etsy - rainbow initial necklace

Instagram Obsessions:

  • @airmailweekly
  • @badonpolitics 

Books Mentioned:

  • The Royal We by Jessica Morgan & Heather Cocks
  • Red, White and Royal Blue by Casey McQuiston
  • Royal Runaway by Lindsay Emory
  • Royals by Rachel Hawkins
  • Fleishman is in Trouble by Taffy Brodessser-Akner
  • The Girl Who Never Read Noam Chomsky by Jana Casale 

Sponsors: 

Care/of: Take 25% your first care of order takecareof.com and enter code BOP at checkout

Equilibria: Go to https://equilibriawomen.com/ for 15% off your first order. Enter code BOP at checkout (Note: the beginner box is not included in this promotion).

item.title: Bad on Politics #1: Alyssa Mastromonaco on How The Primary Process Works & How To Get Involved In Politics
item.itunes:title: Bad on Politics #1: Alyssa Mastromonaco on How The Primary Process Works & How To Get Involved In Politics
item.description:
Friend of the pod and former Obama Deputy Chief of Staff, Alyssa Mastromonaco, joins us to help break down what is happening in the current presidential election. Why are there so many candidates? Is this normal? When will the field narrow? And how does the primary process even work. Then we talk about how to learn about candidate platforms and how to get personally involved in politics.
 
Alyssa's list of recs for understandable, trustworthy political coverage:
@Jessicayellin (IG)
@DMregister (twitter)
@WBUR (twitter)
@ZerlinaMaxwell (twitter)
@Yashar (twitter)
Vote Save America
 
About Bad on Politics: Bad on Politics is a monthly bonus episode where we invite a guest expert to help us break down a political topic. We get it, politics is confusing and there's a anxiety-inducing amount of news coverage to follow. So, we're here to ask the "dumb" questions so you don't have to. We want to break things down so you can understand what's going on and make an informed opinion.

item.description: We're launching a new monthly series and wanted to give you a preview and some context before it goes live! Every month between now and November 2020, we're going to have a bonus episode centered around a political topic. Each month, we'll invite an expert to help school us on an issue or break down what's happening in the election. We can't wait to share our first episode with a repeat visit from Alyssa Mastromonaco.

item.title: Simon Doonan on Drag Culture, Personal Style, and Unplugging from Technology
item.itunes:title: Simon Doonan on Drag Culture, Personal Style, and Unplugging from Technology
item.description:
In this week’s episode, we get to chat with the amazing (sparkly!) Simon Doonan about his brand new book Drag: The Complete Story - the first modern book about the cultural history of drag! Simon talks all things drag with us while answering your questions about finding your own personal style, his relationship with Jonathan Adler, and whether or not he will be appearing on another season of NBC’s Making It (spoiler: he is!).

Products Mentioned:
* Veronica Beard Emerald Suit (Blazer, Pants)
* Amazon Sunglasses

Instagram Obsessions:
* @bat_geo
* @pollywales

Books Mentioned:
* Drag: The Complete Story by Simon Doonan
* The Winker by Andrew Martin
* The International Best Dressed List by Amy Fine Collins
* The catalog for the Camp Exhibit at The Met
* Good Girls Lie by JT Ellison comes out Dec 30th
* The Testaments by Margaret Atwood
* The Girl Who Never Read Noam Chomsky Jena Casale
* September book club  - American Royals by Katharine McGee

item.title: Let’s Talk Time Management: Our Best Productivity Tips.
item.itunes:title: Let’s Talk Time Management: Our Best Productivity Tips
item.description:
In this week’s episode, we discuss how we manage our time, calendars, and inboxes. We also discuss avoiding distractions like Instagram and email (spoiler: we’re a work in progress here), the comparison trap, and our biggest lessons on productivity. Grace explores the power of saying “no” and Becca has plenty of very Virgo-esque tips for organizing your calendar in inbox.

 We also have a very exciting announcement about our NYC show and some strong feelings on hot sauce!

Products Mentioned

  • Becca’s post it notes
  • Planoly
  • Tuexduex App
  • The Daily Goals App
  • Ilia Eyeshadow

item.title: Grace’s Sister Rebecca Atwood Talks Decorating with Color... and Embarrassing Family Stories!
item.itunes:title: Grace’s Sister Rebecca Atwood Talks Decorating with Color... and Embarrassing Family Stories!
item.description:
Today we have Grace’s sister Rebecca Atwood joining us! With two “Becca’s” and two sisters who sound almost exactly alike, things get a little wild! Rebecca is an artist and textile designer who has her own incredible product line and just wrote her second book! Today she's answering all of your questions about home decor... giving us the rundown on tastefully adding more color to our homes (and why “connector colors” are a must)! Stay tuned ‘till the very end for hilarious Atwood sister childhood stories from growing up on Cape Cod.


Products Mentioned:

  • The Breakers Palm Beach Resort
  • White Pepper Paint by Valspar
  • Case for Making Paints
  • Taylor Swift’s Newest Album
  • Grace’s Gold Vintage Mirror from Chairish


Books Mentioned:

  • Living with Color by Rebecca Atwood
  • Living with Pattern by Rebecca Atwood
  • Joyful by Ingrid Fetell Lee
  • American Royals by Katherine McGee
  • The Other’s Gold by Elizabeth Ames
  • We Came Here To Forget by Andrea Dunlop
  • The Family Upstairs by Lisa Jewell
  • Ninth House by Leigh Bardugo

item.title: Lisa Taddeo on the Behind The Scenes Story of Three Women
item.itunes:title: Lisa Taddeo on the Behind The Scenes Story of Three Women
item.description:
Lisa Taddeo, the Author of our August Book Club Pick—Three Women—joins us to share how the book got made. She talked to us about how she found the three women profiled (and the hundreds of others that didn't make the cut), how the book has exceeded her expectations, and what's next for her (hint: there's a TV adaptation in the works).

Books mentioned:

My Brilliant Friend by Elena Ferrante

Troubling Love by Elena Ferrante

The Days of Abandonment by Elena Ferrante

The Little Virtues Natalia Ginzburg

Somebody with a Little Hammer Mary Gaitskill

Lucia Berlin short stories

Anything by Grace Paley

William Trevor short stories

Alice Munro short stories

Tessa Hadley short stories

item.title: Three Women Book Club + Online Dating Updates
item.itunes:title: Three Women Book Club + Online Dating Updates
item.description:
For our August book club, we're tackling our first non-fiction pick: Three Women by Lisa Taddeo. The book explores the psyches and sex lives of three very different women. It's equal parts salacious and emotionally relatable, and we have so much to say about this book. We also catch up about online dating apps, scheduling as self care, and what we've been reading and obsessing over.

Products Mentioned

  • Anthropologie Mirror
  • Rigby
  • Boll and Branch
 
Instagram obsessions

  • Sprout Home Brooklyn

  • Honestly, We Meant Well by Grant Ginder
  • Twice in a Blue Moon by Christina Lauren
  • The Starless Sea by Erin Morgenstern
  • The Luxe Series

item.itunes:title: Morgan Hoit (aka @nycbookgirl) Joins Us To Talk Broadway, Imprints, and #Bookstagram
item.description:
This week we’re joined by Morgan Hoit, marketing manager at Avid Reader Press and voice of NYC Book Girl (one of our favorite bookstagram accounts!). We chat about everything from her love of theatre and how she manages anxiety, to how she feels about the SoulCycle boycott and the three books she can’t wait to read next year.

item.title: Lauren Duca on Political Activism, Coming Out, and Confidence Under Fire
item.itunes:title: Lauren Duca on Political Activism, Coming Out, and Confidence Under Fire
item.description:
This week we're joined by freelance journalist, author, and political activist, Lauren Duca. We chat about her career transition from pop culture to political writer, her hard-won skills on dealing with criticism, and her major year of changes from divorce to coming out. But most importantly, we also chat about her forthcoming book: How to Start A Revolution (out Sept 24).

Books Mentioned:

How to Start A Revolution (Lauren's Book!)

My Friend Anna by Rachel Deloache Williams

The Turn of the Key by Ruth Ware

The Luxe Series by Anna Godbersen

Boy Swallows Universe by Trent Dalton

item.title: Summer Beauty Product Update + Announcing Our Fall Tour Dates!
item.itunes:title: Summer Beauty Product Update + Announcing Our Fall Tour Dates!
item.description:
Today it's just us, and we're talking about all things BEAUTY! We both discuss the products we're loving (or in some cases a little underwhelmed by) this summer. We talk everything from skincare and makeup to sunless tanning, SPF, and hair removal.

But before that, we announce our Fall tour dates! We're hitting 6 cities this fall and are hoping to announce a couple more dates soon. If you live in San Francisco, Atlanta, DC, Philly, Dallas, or New York we hope to see you there!

Also in this episode: Grace got to see Where'd You Go Bernadette early (and has a dating low) and Becca is now the proud owner of the most gorgeous built-in bookshelves!

Sponsor: 

  • HELLOFRESH: Go to Hellofresh.com/BOP80 and use code BOP80 for $80 off your first month of meals.

item.title: Lauren Wilkinson Joins us to Talk About Her Book, American Spy!
item.itunes:title: Lauren Wilkinson Joins us to Talk About Her Book, American Spy!
item.description:
It's time for our July Book Club and today we are discussing American Spy. We are so honored that the author, Lauren Wilkinson, is joining us remotely! We talk about the book, her writing process (she rewrote it SIX times!), how the book began (a grad school assignment about a suburban family) and why she chose to leave the book open-ended. We also talk about more difficult social topics and how that inspired the book. This interview was so interesting.

Also in this episode, Grace is feeling like a celebrity (she went on a yoga retreat with a personal chef and she just got verified on Instagram) and Becca admits that she still thinks about the game Bloody Mary every time she goes to the bathroom at night.

Follow Lauren at @thrillkinson on Instagram and Twitter… and of course, buy her book!

Sponsor:

  • Night Pillow: For 20% off your Night Pillow, go to Discovernight.com and enter code BOP20 at checkout. 

Books Mentioned

American Spy

Philosophy of Ruin

Devotion

Beijing Payback

The Quiet American

Rogue Male

Three Women

Lock Every Door

With the Fire on High

Tell Me Everything

The Wedding Party

My Friend Anna

Whisper Network

 

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

Follow us on Instagram @badonpaperpodcast

item.title: Always Ask For More Money – Negotiating Your Salary, Getting A Promotion, and Setting Freelance Rates
item.itunes:title: Always Ask For More Money – Negotiating Your Salary, Getting A Promotion, and Setting Freelance Rates
item.description:
In this episode, we’re talking MONEY. From salaries (actual numbers!) to negotiations, asking for raises, and talking to your friends about money, we are diving deep. We answer your questions like how often do you ask for a raise and how to know how much to ask for? Becca steps on her soapbox when talking about stock options and how she wishes she could give her past self this advice. No matter where you are in life, we hope you find this episode helpful! 

Sponsor:

  • Bark Box: To get a free extra month on a 6 or 12 month subscription, go to barkbox.com/BOP.

 My Friend Anna

item.title: Alex Dickerson Joins Us to Discuss Friendship, Careers, Angry Cats, and Bad Break-Ups.
item.itunes:title: Alex Dickerson Joins Us to Discuss Friendship, Careers, Angry Cats, and Bad Break-Ups.
item.description:
In this episode, we are joined our third sorority house member (and other best friend), Alex Dickerson. It's a longer episode and we talk about everything from friendship and dating to careers and going back to school for na MBA. There's also a mini Grace roast and a few embarrassing stories. Alex has had an incredible career thus far, complete with nearly being the star of a reality TV show and going to business school in Barcelona. We also talk about her messy dating story (+ broken engagement), and how that has shaped her into the person she is today. This episode was so much fun, and we hope you love Alex as much as we do! 

Also in this episode, Becca has purchased a fancy home luggage stand, and Grace is obsessed with Sephora’s new clean beauty line. If you’re looking for a new read, join us for our July book club where we talk about American Spy.

Sponsors:

  • Night Pillow:
    • For 20% off your entire order, visit discovernight.com and enter code BOP20 at checkout.
  • Modern Fertility:
    • For $20 off your first kit, visit modernfertility.com/BOP.

Books Mentioned:

Tell Me Lies

Save Me the Plums

Three Women

item.title: Answering Your Questions About... Everything!!
item.itunes:title: Answering Your Questions About... Everything!
item.description:
It’s just us this week, and we’ve got all your questions covered. We truly cover a little bit of everything in this episode, like dating (yes, we are on the apps. No, it’s not fun), travel rituals, reading (of course!), the future of the pod (total world podcast domination), and so much more! It was fun to get to interview ourselves this week!

Meanwhile, Grace is feeling like she’s getting her life together post-tour, and Becca read two full books during the long weekend. Also, head to our Instagram for a chance to win a copy of our July book club, American Spy!

item.title: Akilah Hughes Shares Her Writing Process, Tips on Self-Confidence, and Her Love of Neopets.
item.itunes:title: Akilah Hughes Shares Her Writing Process, Tips on Self-Confidence, and Her Love of Neopets.
item.description:
Today’s guest is the hilarious and brilliant Akilah Hughes! From YouTube to politics to writing her own book, there's nothing she can't do! We talk about a little bit of everything, from her favorite and least favorite part about traveling (hotels! touching things in the airport!), growing up in the south, how to feel confident on bad days, and… Neopets. 

Also in this episode, we’ve wrapped up our summer tour! We’re definitely ready for some introvert time. Also, Becca reveals that her cleaning lady ghosted her and Grace is obsessed with Katie Sturino’s clothing line with Stitch Fix!

To keep up with our new friend Akilah, follow her on Twitter at @akilahobviously, on Instagram at @Akilahh, on YouTube, and pre-order her book, Obviously: Stories from my Timeline.

Sponsor:

item.title: The Idea of You Book Club + Emotional Support Group.
item.itunes:title: The Idea of You Book Club + Emotional Support Group.
item.description:
It's our June Book Club! Today is Becca's Superbowl... also known as The Idea of You Emotional Support Group. If you’ve been listening for a while you know how OBSESSED we are with this book. Seriously, we’re still trying to figure out how life continues after reading it. We finally get to talk about it today. Becca has begun her healing process through writing her own sequel. In light of this book, Becca and Grace talk about their favorite boy band, leading to a heated debate over whether or not Mark Wahlberg was actually a real member of New Kids on the Block. Finally, we talk about the youngest age we would date and whether that changes if he was famous (hint: it does). 

Also in this episode, Grace had a mini college reunion at the Boston live show and Becca is still distraught over this book, but is recovering with the show Dead to Me.  

PSA: Tomorrow we are releasing a bonus episode with the incredible writer of this book, Robinne Lee, where we practically beg for a sequel. Don’t miss it!

Sponsor:

  • Beauty Pie: To get $50 extra allowance to use on your first month, go to beautypie.com and use code GRACESENTME
  • Hello Fresh: For $80 off your first month of Hello Fresh, go to hellofresh.com/BOP and enter code BOP at checkout

 

Books Mentioned:

The Idea of You

City of Girls

Tell Me Lies

Match Making for Beginners

Mrs. Everything

I Miss You When I Blink

A Nearly Normal Family

The Bookish Life of Nina Hill

item.title: Ep 59: Aliza Licht Shares the Most Honest Career Advice We've Heard.
item.itunes:title: Ep 59: Aliza Licht Shares the Most Honest Career Advice We've Heard.
item.description:
We couldn't be more excited to have Aliza Licht with us this week! You may know her as "DKNY PR Girl" back in the day on Twitter and Tumblr. She recently left her role at Alice & Olivia and is launching her own podcast SOON. In today's episode, she answers all fo your career questions and gives some of the best and most honest career advice we've heard - advice for interns, why "Can I pick your brain" is everyone's least favorite question, the importance of paper trails, DIY PR strategies, and so much more.

Also in this episode, Becca has found the best place to buy blinds (we're such adults) and Grace is binge-watching a new show.

Make sure to follow Aliza on twitter and instagram, and buy her book, Leave Your Mark!

  • Night Pillow: For 20% off your Night Pillow, visit DiscoverNight.com and enter code BOP20 at checkout.

item.title: Ep 58: The Nitty Gritty of Our Morning Routines
item.itunes:title: Ep 58: The Nitty Gritty of Our Morning Routines
item.description:
Today it's just us, and we're interviewing each other about the nitty gritty of our morning routines. From breakfast to beauty products, we're breaking down our morning rituals.

This episode was inspired by a series on A Few Things with Claire And Erica. It's one of our favorite podcasts, you should check it out!

Also in this episode, Grace met (and clung for dear life to) Peter Hermann from Younger and Becca has a mortifying Uber saga that ended in -1 pairs of shoes.

item.title: Ep 57: Makeup Lessons with Cassandra Garcia.
item.itunes:title: Ep 57: Makeup Lessons with Cassandra Garcia.
item.description:
Today we interviewed Cassandra Garcia... makeup artist to THE STARS... and us! Cassandra did our makeup for the NYC live show but she's also the in-house makeup artist for Bobbi Brown AND she does makeup for the cast of SNL. (+ other celebs!!) We gathered ALL your makeup questions for her and put her to the test. You may want to grab a notebook for this one as it gets pretty technical - in the best possible way. We're talking about making your makeup last, under eye concealer that won't settle into fine lines, and more. Do you really need a primer? What about a setting spray? Cassandra also shares her favorite luxury products + cheapie drugstore finds.

PS - the long wear cream eyeshadow we keep talking about is SHORE by Bobbi Brown. Not "Sure" or "The Shore!"

Be sure to follow Cassandra at @cygmakeup!

Sponsor: 

  • Night Pillow: For 20% off your Night Pillow, visit DiscoverNight.com and enter code BOP20 at checkout.

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

item.title: Ep. 56: Normal People Book Club + What Makes a Book YA!?
item.itunes:title: Ep. 56: Normal People Book Club + What Makes a Book YA!?
item.description:
In this episode, we are talking about Normal People by Sally Rooney! We loved this book. In fact, we both agree that it’s one of the best books we've read this year. BUT we couldn’t decide… is it a “Young Adult” book? Let us know what you think! In light of this book, we talk about our own secret romances (or lack thereof!), power dynamics in relationships, and how your confidence can shift (for better or worse) over time.

Also, Becca had the worst travel day of her life, Grace is loving @sanctuarywrld on Instagram, and Becca and Grace are both obsessed with the Charlotte Tilbury Wonderglow Primer!

  • Modern Fertility: For $20 off your first kit, go to modernfertility.com/BOP.

item.title: Ep. 55: Linda Wells - Beauty, Career Advice, and Life after Allure.
item.itunes:title: Ep. 55: Linda Wells - Beauty, Career Advice, and Life after Allure.
item.description:
This week's guest needs no introduction! Linda Wells, the founder of Flesh Beauty and founding editor at Allure Magazine joins us for a conversation about beauty, careers, and more. Linda walks us through her entire career, beginning with her first interviews right out of college (and when her interviewer made her cry), to launching Allure, and most recently the creation of Flesh. We also dive into career advice, behind the scenes of the Best of Beauty awards, and of course, her favorite products! It was truly an honor to get to sit down with such a beauty icon! 

Also in this episode, Grace and Becca have created their own sorority house, Grace is obsessed with @90sanxiety on Instagram, and Becca has fallen in love with @margaux shoes!

Make sure to follow Linda at @lindawellsny and @fleshbeauty.

Sponsor: 

  • Night Pillow: For 20% off your Night Pillow, visit DiscoverNight.com and enter code BOP20 at checkout.

Books Mentioned:

That's What Frenemies Are For: A Novel

Fitness Junkie

The Knockoff

The Overstory

American Spy

Normal People

Middle March

Maybe You Should Talk to Someone

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

item.title: Ep. 54: Your 20s v 30s: work, relationships, and what we’ve learned
item.itunes:title: Ep. 54: Your 20s v 30s: work, relationships, and what we’ve learned
item.description:
It's just us this episode!! We’re doing a little bit of self-reflection today, talking about the differences between being in your twenties versus your thirties. Hopefully, for those of you in your twenties, we can offer a little advice. And for those of you in your thirties with us, we know you’ll relate! From the difference in how we date now, to what we thought our lives would look like in our thirties, this episode was fun to reflect on.

Also in this episode, Becca is obsessed with organizing her new apartment, and Grace is obsessed with her new Veronica Beard jacket!

item.title: Ep. 53: Ashley & Rayna from Girls Gotta Eat Talk Dating, Finding Friends on Instagram, & Creating a Life You Love.
item.itunes:title: Ep. 53: Ashley & Rayna from Girls Gotta Eat Talk Dating, Finding Friends on Instagram, & Creating a Life You Love.
item.description:
In this episode, we had so much fun recording with the Rayna Greenberg and Ashley Hesseltine from the Girls Gotta Eat Podcast! We talk about all things dating, from go-to first date outfits, to getting over a break-up (like… NOW), and of course, how to handle people who hound you about your love life. We also talk about making friends as an adult (it might include starting your own podcast!), creating a life you love, and the best restaurants in NYC.

Also in this episode, Becca is curtain-less, so she’s nervous about becoming the next Beck from You, and Grace is trying to find Tyrion a new best-dog-friend.

Make sure to follow @girlsgottaeatpodcast, @ashhess, and @onehungryjew on Instagram to keep up with them, and visit StupidLiveShows.com to find a Girls Gotta Eat live show near you!

Sponsors:

  • Harper Wilde: To try on your first bra set and receive a free gift, go to com/BOP.

  • Shortest Way Home
  • My Lovely Wife

item.itunes:title: Kathryn Gallagher Talks Body Confidence, Advice for Aspiring Actors, & Non-Terrible Times Square Places.
item.description:
In this episode, we sat down with the extremely talented and hilarious Kathryn Gallagher, one of the stars of one of our favorite shows, You! We love Kathryn’s focus body positivity and her perspective on how to handle the hard days. She also gives great advice on developing more confidence and for aspiring actors. Kathryn is amazing, and we know you’re gonna love her!

Also in this episode, WE’RE GOING ON TOUR! Go to badonpaper.com/live to find more details and buy tickets! Also, Becca is officially Grace’s neighbor, and Grace is obsessing over @drawingsofdogs on Instagram! 

You can our new IRL friend on Instagram at @kathryngallagher, Twitter at @kathryng, and watch her in  the new musical, Jagged Little Pill.

item.title: Bonus Ep. 51: Helena Glazer on Motherhood & Marriage, Blogging, & Finding Balance in It All.
item.itunes:title: Bonus Ep. 51: Helena Glazer on Motherhood & Marriage, Blogging, & Finding Balance in It All.
item.description:
We’re back for a bonus episode with no other than Helena Glazer. We couldn’t get enough of her! Today we are talking about marriage and parenthood, and balancing both with her successful blog, Brooklyn Blonde! We also talk about her holy grail skincare and listening to what your skin needs, balancing “Insta-pretty” and “Insta-real,” and the secret to walking in heels in the city (hint… it involves a second pair of shoes).

We had such a blast recording this episode with Helena. Make sure to follow her on Instagram (@brooklynblonde1) and read her blog here!

item.content:encoded:
We’re back for a bonus episode with no other than Helena Glazer. We couldn’t get enough of her! Today we are talking about marriage and parenthood, and balancing both with her successful blog, Brooklyn Blonde! We also talk about her holy grail skincare and listening to what your skin needs, balancing “Insta-pretty” and “Insta-real,” and the secret to walking in heels in the city (hint… it involves a second pair of shoes).

We had such a blast recording this episode with Helena. Make sure to follow her on Instagram (@brooklynblonde1) and read her blog here! 

Sponsor:

  • Night Pillow: For 20% off your Night Pillow, go to discovernight.com and enter code BOP20 at checkout.

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

Also in this episode, Becca is obsessed with the Sleep Cycle app, and Grace loves following body-positive influencer, @CaralynMirand.

item.title: Ep. 49: What's It REALLY Like To Work For Yourself? Pitching, Finances, And Work/Life Balance When You're Self-Employed.
item.itunes:title: Ep. 49: What's It REALLY Like To Work For Yourself? Pitching, Finances, And Work/Life Balance When You're Self-Employed.
item.description:
In this episode, we are talking about work, specifically striking out on your own and being your own boss. We talk about our past jobs, how we decided to start working for ourselves, and the best and worst parts of self-employment. Plus we get super honest about how we manage finances while being self-employed. Of course, we have lots of hard-won advice for anyone who is considering going out on their own.

Also in this episode, Grace is obsessed with a future BOP guest and You star, Kathryn Gallagher and Becca is obsessed @PuntaCaliza (The hotel G&B stayed at on their recent Mexico trip). And... BIG NEWS… we are going on a (mini) TOUR! Make sure to follow @badonpaperpodcast to be the first to know the tour details!

 Sponsor:

  • Night Pillow: For 20% off your Night Pillow, go to www.discovernight.com and enter code BOP20 at checkout.
  • Hello Fresh: For $80 off your first month of Hello Fresh, go to www.hellofresh.com/BOP80 and enter code BOP80 at checkout.

The Idea of You– GRACE LOVED IT.

Behind Her Eyes

Rules of Civility

Daisy Jones and the Six

Who’s That Girl

City of Girls

The Lost Vintage

item.title: Ep. 48: Indie Lee on Clean Beauty, Living Life 80/20, and Doing What Makes You Happy.
item.itunes:title: Ep. 48: Indie Lee on Clean Beauty, Living Life 80/20, and Doing What Makes You Happy.
item.description:
In this episode, we sat down with Indie Lee, founder of her namesake clean beauty brand. Indie has an incredible story that led to not only led to her finding her purpose and passion (and launching her amazing beauty line), but also her insanely positive outlook on life. We talk about living life following the 80/20 rule, skincare products worth splurging on, and doing what makes you happiest. Indie is a breath of fresh air - we loved getting to sit down with her.

Also in this episode, we are still on a high from our live show, Becca is about to be Grace's neighbor, and Grace is officially part of the Sephora Squad! 

Make sure to follow @indie_lee on Instagram, and check out her amazing products at indielee.com! Through the end of April use code BOP15 to take 15% off.

Sponsor:

  • Lola: For 40% off of all subscriptions, visit www.mylola.com and enter code BOP at checkout. 

Books Mentioned:

It Ends with Us

The Idea of You

Don’t You Forget About Me

Who’s That Girl

Normal People

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

item.title: Ep. 47: Alyssa Mastromonaco - the Obamas, the Importance of Lists, and Staying Calm Under Pressure.
item.itunes:title: Ep. 47: Alyssa Mastromonaco - the Obamas, the Importance of Lists, and Staying Calm Under Pressure.
item.description:
We are so excited about today's guest: Alyssa Mastromonaco. Alyssa is the co-host of the Crooked Media podcast Hysteria, a New York Times Best Selling Author, AND was the White House Deputy Chief of Staff for Operations for the Obama administration! We ask her a million questions, from how to stay calm in a high pressure job, to how to talk productive conversations with people whose political views differ from yours, to three things she would take to a desert island. This episode is one of our all time favorites!

Also in this episode, Grace is obsessed with @averagefashionblogger, and Becca is battling with overly-optimistic “Past Becca.”

You can find Alyssa on Twitter at @alyssamastro44, and on Instagram at @Mastro175

Sponsor:

  • Harper Wilde: To get started with your free at home try on and receive a complimentary bra wash bag, visit harperwilde.com/BOP.

Books Mentioned:

Who Thought This Was a Good Idea?

So Here’s the Thing

Are You There, Vodka? It’s Me, Chelsea.

Is Everyone Hanging Out Without Me? (And Other Concerns)

Why Not Me?

The Unhoneymooners

I’m Fine and Neither Are You

Normal People

Daisy Jones & the Six: a Novel

The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo: a Novel

item.title: Ep. 46: Verity Book Club + Channeling "Mediocre White Man Confidence."
item.itunes:title: Ep. 46: Verity Book Club + Channeling "Mediocre White Man Confidence."
item.description:
In this episode, we are talking about the craziest, scariest and most twisted book: Verity by Colleen Hoover. YOU GUYS. It’s hard to put this book into words, because it was so good and so messed up! Becca was terrified to quit reading this book because she knew she would have nightmares, and Grace went out drinking when she finished it. We can’t wait to hear your thoughts on it!

Also in this episode, WE SOLD OUT OUR LIVE SHOW! We are convinced you can do anything if you have the confidence of a mediocre white man. Also, Becca is obsessed with an investment app called Robinhood (use this link, you and Becca get a free stock), and Grace isn't as good of shape as she thought. 

Books Mentioned

Verity

Gone Girl

Final Girls

The Woman Inside

An Anonymous Girl

The Wife Between Us

The Last Mrs. Parrish

The Couple Next Door

The Last Time I Lied

The Woman in the Window

The Good Liar

So Here’s the Thing

Becoming

Rules of Magic

 

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

Follow us on Instagram @badonpaperpodcast

item.title: Ep. 45: Chinae Alexander Talks Holy Grail Skincare, Dating App Success, & Body Confidence.
item.itunes:title: Ep. 45: Chinae Alexander Talks Holy Grail Skincare, Dating App Success, & Body Confidence.
item.description:
In this episode, we are talking to one of the most inspiring people on Instagram (and one of our live show guests!), Chinae Alexander! Chinae is an influencer, a podcast host (check out Press Send!), a makeup extraordinaire, and fitness icon. We talk about a little of everything, from removing toxicity and body confidence, to her holy grail skincare products and her favorite under-the-radar makeup brands. Chinae also shares her amazing dating app success story and her stance on the pressure surrounding the passions and jobs.

Also in this episode, Grace is obsessed with @theflairindex on Instagram and Becca has finally found the perfect sleep shirt from Recliner! Make sure to buy your ticket to the live show because we are almost sold out!

You can find Chinae at @chinaealexander on Instagram and listen to her on Press Send podcast!

item.title: Ep. 44: Hitha Palepu on Motherhood, Productivity, Investing, and Travel & How She Defines "Smart" Reading.
item.itunes:title: Ep. 44: Hitha Palepu on Motherhood, Productivity, Investing, and Travel & How She Defines "Smart" Reading.
item.description:
In today’s episode, we have the incredible Hitha Palepu! Seriously, is there anything that Hitha can’t do? You’ve heard us obsess over her Five Smart Reads newsletter, but Hitha is also the CEO and co-founder of Rho Pharmaceuticals, the creator of the blog “Hitha on the Go,” the author of How to Pack: Travel Smart for Any Trip, and a full time mom (Our first mom to be featured on the pod!) to her son Rho, with another on the way! We’re tired just thinking about how she does it all. Hitha shares incredible advice, from her packing essentials and her travel skincare routine, to key productivity practices and investment tips for beginners. We feel smarter after recording this episode.  


Also in this episode, Grace is obsessed with her pink faux fur slippers (from Amazon!), Becca is slowlyyy recovering from her Idea of You book hangover, and Hitha is loving @notenoughhangers.

 

Find our friend on the internet at @hithapalepu and hithaonthego.com/5smartreads to sign up for her newsletter!

Books Mentioned :

Favorite Books Read in High School:

  • The Sloppy Firsts
  • 1984
  • Grapes of Wrath
  • The Awakening 
  • Protect and Defend

Others:

  • An Anonymous Girl – same author of The Wife Between Us
  • Tell Me Lies
  • Lost Roses – prequel to Lilac Girls
  • Rules of Civility
  • The Master Plan
  • The Idea of You – Becca is still not over it
  • I Miss You When I Blink
  • I am Pilgram
  • Verity – March’s Book Club!

 

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

Follow us on Instagram @badonpaperpodcast

item.title: Bonus Ep 42: Ashley Spivey on Books, the Bachelor, and a Weird Sexual Experience.
item.itunes:title: Bonus Ep 42: Ashley Spivey on Books, the Bachelor, and a Weird Sexual Experience.
item.description:
It's our first bonus episode! And with no other than our favorite book lover, Ashley Spivey! We just couldn't get enough of her. Today we are talking all things the Bachelor (Becca thinks someone should write a dystopian book about what happens behind the scenes), books (including her favorite book instagrammers - get a notepad ready!), and seriously the weirdest questions you guys have ever asked (like..."Have you ever seen Leonardo Dicaprio from your apartment?"). 

We had a blast recording this episode with the help of a few margaritas. Make sure to follow Ashley at @ashleyspivey and join her book club! 

Books mentioned

The Dinner List by Rebecca Serle

Tell the Wolves I'm Home by Carol Rifka Brunt

The Sun is Also A Star by Nicola Yoon

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

item.title: Ep. 41: Ashley Spivey Co-Hosts the 99 Percent Mine Book Club!
item.itunes:title: Ep. 41: Ashley Spivey Co-Hosts the 99 Percent Mine Book Club!
item.description:
In this episode, we are joined by our favorite fellow book lover, Ashley Spivey, to talk about this month's bookclub pick, 99 Percent Mine by Sally Thorne. Ashley runs a Facebook group bookclub with over 11,000 members, co-hosts the podcast He Said She Said, AND was on The Bachelor! We can't think of a better fit to help us talk about this month's book. Readers beware... by the end of this episode, you may just have a cart full of new books because Ashley's recommendations are endless!

Also in this episode, Ashley is taking submissions for her book idea, Becca has injured herself (any doctors out there know what she's done?!), and Grace indulges in top-shelf mascara.We are also stoked to announce that Casey Balsham will be opening the live show with stand-up comedy!

Because Ashley is amazing and we had so many questions for her, we are releasing a BONUS episode next Monday where we will talk all things books and The Bachelor. You can follow @ashleyspivey here and join her book club here!

Sponsors:

Care/Of: Take 50% off your first month of personalized vitamins by going to takecareof.com and entering code BOP50 at checkout.

Modern Fertility: Get $20 off your first kit by going to modernfertility.com/bop 

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

Follow us on Instagram @badonpaperpodcast

item.title: Ep 40: Blair Eadie from Atlantic-Pacific on Her Best Fashion & Life Advice, Her Avril Lavigne Phase, and Why She Won’t Marie Kondo Her Closet
item.itunes:title: Ep 40: Blair Eadie from Atlantic-Pacific on Her Best Fashion & Life Advice, Her Avril Lavigne Phase, and Why She Won’t Marie Kondo Her Closet
item.description:
In this episode, we sat down with the fashionable, smart, and all-around wonderful Blair Eadie, the founder of Atlantic-Pacific! We ask her all your fashion and life questions, like why she started her blog, why she has chosen to keep it fashion-focused, her go to bargain finds, and the worst fad she participated in during high school (it includes an Avril Lavigne phase). Plus: the behind the scenes scoop on her clothing line and how wedding planning is going. We LOVE her and we know you will too! You can find her at @blaireadiebee and The-Atlantic-Pacific. 

Also in this episode, Becca is obsessed with her new jeans for tall ladies discovery, Grace is loving artist Melvin G., and Blair is obsessed with Local Electric jewelry!

Make sure you've read 99 Percent Mine by Sally Thorne, because next week we have Ashley Spivey from Spivey’s Book Club (and the Bachelor!) joining us for our February book club!  

Sponsor:

Dudley Stephens: Visit Dudley-Stephens.com and enter promo code BOP20 at checkout for 20% off your first purchase. Come twin with us!  

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

Follow us on Instagram @badonpaperpodcast

item.title: Ep. 39: “How the F do I make friends as an adult?!” Friendship + Galentine’s Day
item.itunes:title: Ep. 39: “How the F do I make friends as an adult?!” Friendship + Galentine’s Day
item.description:
Happy Galentine’s Day! We are celebrating this girl power holiday by going on a friend-date and of course, hanging out with you! We are answering the age old question… “How the F do I make friends as an adult?!” Plus, how to set boundaries with friends, balancing boyfriends and gal pals, how cupcakes can mend friend fallouts, and how to have a successful long-distance friendship.

Also in this episode, Becca is obsessed with her new Halogen sweater, and Grace is loving the Instagram account History Cool Kids.

item.title: Ep 38: Jared Freid on Dating, "Everyone is someone's foot"
item.itunes:title: Ep 38: Jared Freid on Dating, "Everyone is someone's foot"
item.description:
In this episode, we sat down with Jared Freid, a prolific podcast host, dating expert, and standup comedian! We couldn't stop laughing the entire episode! We ask all of your dating questions, including what to say to people who claim you are "too picky" and why ex still watches your Instagram stories. 

Also in this episode, Becca finds out that her dream job exists (there are people who write Lifetime movies as their full time job?!), Jared is obsessed with TLC (the TV network... not the girl group), and as always, Grace is obsessed with Dunkin' Donuts!

Make sure to follow @jaredfreid on Instagram!

Check out his other podcasts: U up? and J-Train 

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

item.title: Ep. 37: Little White Lies Book Club, a Cookbook Bender, & a Stoned Cat.
item.itunes:title: Ep. 37: Little White Lies Book Club, a Cookbook Bender, & a Stoned Cat.
item.description:
It’s our first book episode of 2019! Today we are talking about Little White Lies by Jennifer Lynn Barnes. We loved it! It’s a little bit Gossip Girl and a little bit Pretty Little Liars or Paper Princess. This book is soap opera-level drama and it has a twist so good, even Grace didn’t see it coming! We can’t wait to hear your thoughts on this book. Speaking of books, Grace finished her tenth book of 2019 this weekend, while Becca finished her seventh. Also, Grace has resolved to only buy books from bookstores, and Becca can’t stop buying cookbooks!

Also in this episode,  we read our favorite review we’ve ever gotten (TexasListener101… we’re looking at you!) where we were compared to Sex and the City characters. To top it all off, Tyrion is ultra stoned on catnip! 

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

Follow us on Instagram @badonpaperpodcast

item.title: Ep. 36: Danielle Prescod's Best Life Advice and Fashion Tips, SoulCycle Dates, & a Talk About Mental Health!
item.description:
In this episode, we get to hang with BET style director Danielle Prescod, and we are obsessed! She is a self-proclaimed over sharer so this episode was extra fun to record! Danielle is a pop-culture expert, style icon, and fitness enthusiast. We asked her all your questions in a fun lightening round (including tips on how to take the best selfie and of course, DATING) and she walks us through her career thus far, and how she ended up at BET! 

Also in this episode, Becca and Danielle decide to have a SoulCycle date, and Grace can’t stop binge-watching You (and she is creeped out). Don’t forget to read our first book club pick of the year, Little White Lies, by Jennifer Lynn Barnes. We can’t wait to talk about it next week!  

You can find our friend crush at @danielleprescod!

 Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

Follow us on Instagram @badonpaperpodcast

item.title: Ep. 35: A Very Healthy Pod. Celery Juice, New Cookbooks, Upright Training, & Healthy Intentions.
item.itunes:title: Ep. 35: A Very Healthy Pod. Celery Juice, New Cookbooks, Upright Training, & Healthy Intentions.
item.description:
In this episode, we are talking all things wellness! We evaluate our health goals for 2019 and how we're doing. We talk about our current health-strengths, and where we need improvement (Grace admits "Dry-January" isn't going as planned)! Becca is on a cookbook craze and Grace is a solid week into the celery juice craze.

Also in this episode, Grace got a gadget to fix her posture and Becca has a book hangover!

item.title: Ep 34: Katie Sturino on Body Neutrality & Celery Juicing Our Way Into 2019
item.itunes:title: Ep 34: the Amazing Katie Sturino + a Talk on Body Positivity.
item.description:
In this episode, we are so excited to hangout with Katie Sturino from @the12ishstyle and the founder of Megababe! We LOVE her and we know you will too! We ask all of your questions and talk about everything from body positivity to our best first date ideas. This may just be our favorite episode yet!

Also in this episode, Grace and Katie share their love/hate relationship with celery juice and Becca discovers how much she loves chicken thighs! Tyrion also got a remote control mouse for Christmas and he’s not sure how he feels about it.

You can follow Katie (and obsess over her like we do!) at @the12ishstyle and @megababe. Find the amazing Megababe Thigh Rescue at https://megababebeauty.com/! Also, you can find the empowering article Katie wrote on loving her body here!

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

item.itunes:title: Ep 28: Charlotte Walsh Likes to Win Book Club.
item.description:
This episode we're discussing our adult book of the month, Charlotte Walsh Likes to Win, by Jo Piazza! We LOVED this book. It's simultaneously such an important book (it's the first fiction book about a woman running for office), but it's also a light, easy read.

This book sparked some important conversation (We were nervous to talk about politics here!) 

Join us next week for advice, and in two weeks for our YA Pick... Children of Bone and Blood!

item.title: Ep 27: Two Tough Topics — My Boyfriend's Friends Hate Me & Should I Break Up With My Bestie?
item.itunes:title: Ep 27: Two Tough Topics — My Boyfriend's Friends Hate Me & Should I Break Up With My Bestie?
item.description:
On this week's advice ep, we're diving deep on two in-depth advice queries. In the first, a listener is struggling with being hated by her boyfriend's friends. Then, we reply to another listener question from someone who is wondering if they should break up with their bestie.

But it's not all tough situations! Becca has a work victory, Grace finally got some quality time with her gravity blanket, and we have a new favorite podcast. Plus, we explore the joy that is The Rock's Instagram account.

item.title: Ep 26: Save the Date Book Club + All the Nostalgic feels.
item.itunes:title: Ep 26: Save the Date Book Club + All the Nostalgic feels.
item.description:
This episode we're discussing our YA book of the month, Save the Date by Morgan Matson. This is the cute story of a big family, + a wedding where anything and everything can go wrong. Spoiler alert (though you probably already guessed it) Becca loved it, Grace was just meh. 

This episode made us nostalgic! It gave Becca big family envy and made Grace think about the nice boys she dated in high school. Oh, to be young!

Join us next week for advice, and in two weeks for our "adult" pick: Charlotte Walsh Likes To Win - we both really loved this book and can't wait to chat about it.

 

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

item.title: Ep 25: New Season, New Us! We're Talking Habits, Routines, and Dealing with Change
item.itunes:title: Ep 25: New Season, New Us! We're Talking Habits, Routines, and Dealing with Change
item.description:
We're back from our mini hiatus and getting back into the swing of things after a summer of travel. We've got that new school year feeling and are ready to get into some new habits and routines and kick our work lives into high gear!

Plus, we have thoughts to share from our trips (Becca to Portugal, Grace to Sweden), so many reading recs, and infinite joyful that gravity blanket season is upon us.

Join us on October 3 for our next book club discussing Save the Date by Morgan Matson.

We're back from our mini hiatus and getting back into the swing of things after a summer of travel. We've got that new school year feeling and are ready to get into some new habits and routines and kick our work lives into high gear!

Plus, we have thoughts to share from our trips (Becca to Portugal, Grace to Sweden), so many reading recs, and infinite joyful that gravity blanket season is upon us.

item.title: Ep 24: Ghosted Book Club, + Our Best (Worst?) Stories of Being Ghosted! (Also, hi from Morocco.)
item.itunes:title: Ep 24: Ghosted Book Club, + Our Best (Worst?) Stories of Being Ghosted! (Also, hi from Morocco.)
item.description:
This episode we're discussing our "adult" book of the month, Ghosted by Rosie Walsh. Sarah and Eddie fall in love, and then he bails. But what really happens? Turns out they both have some pretty big secrets. There are a few twists in this one (which we didn't see coming), and it inspired us to talk a little bit about dating in New York (it's a battlefield). We both share our best (worst?) stories of being ghosted.

We recorded this episode while on vacation in Morocco. This was one of the best trips either of us have taken and we spill all the details in the post!

We are taking a two week hiatus but will be back on September 26th with an advice ep! In the meantime, our next book is Save the Date by Morgan Matson.

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

item.title: Ep 23: We've Got Wanderlust — All Your Travel Questions Answered. Plus, Grace's Passport Drama And Becca's Work Turnaround!
item.itunes:title: Ep 23: We've Got Wanderlust — All Your Travel Questions Answered. Plus, Grace's Passport Drama And Becca's Work Turnaround!
item.description:
We're headed to Morocco today, so we have travel on the brain. Not to mention, we both have a serious case of wanderlust, generally. This week, we're answering all your travel questions — from the best apps for flights, our top destinations to travel next, and our packing strategy (or in Becca's case, lack thereof)!

In other news, Grace almost couldn't go on this trip because of her passport drama, Becca's work life had a real turnaround (from low to high in one week), and Grace has a new style inspiration (Dads and retirees?).

Join us on September 5 for our next book club discussing Ghosted by Rosie Walsh.

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

item.title: Ep 22: Circe Book Club and Hello From Cape Cod.
item.itunes:title: Ep 22: Circe Book Club and Hello From Cape Cod.
item.description:
This episode we're discussing our YA book of the month (even thought it's not really YA if you ask us), Circe by Madeline Miller. While a knowledge of Greek Mythology is definitely not mandatory to enjoy this book, if you loved mythology in school (we did!) this book will feel like a deeply personal reunion with all your mythology favs. We loved this book!!!

We recorded this episode in Grace's parents' living room on Cape Cod. Cape Cod was both of our highs of the week - Grace came for a week and Becca came for the weekend. So nice to get a little sunshine and relaxation!

Join us on August 22nd for our next Book Club to discuss Circe by Madeline Miller. And we will be putting out a call on Instagram for questions for our next advice episode!

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

item.title: Ep 20: All We Ever Wanted Book Club, Becca's Mexico City Adventures and Grace's Bad Luck.
item.itunes:title: Ep 20: All We Ever Wanted Book Club, Becca's Mexico City Adventures and Grace's Bad Luck.
item.description:
This episode we're discussing another "adult" (not YA) book, All We Ever Wanted by Emily Giffin. She is one of our favorite authors and we both felt the same way. We didn't know if we'd like it, but we LOVED IT!!!

Also in this episode: Becca's Mexico City adventure (spoiler: she might move there), Grace's recent streak of bad luck (RIP laptop), our instagram obsessions (@thatlinearttho and @sheisnotlost), and much more. Grace is whipping up DIY beauty concoctions, Becca is taking Spanish lessons... we have a lot to say!

Join us on August 22nd for our next Book Club to discuss Circe by Madeline Miller. And we will be putting out a call on Instagram for questions for our next advice episode!

item.title: Ep 19: Advice - Beauty Bonanza With Jackie Kropp, Senior Editorial Director at Sephora
item.itunes:title: Ep 19: Advice - Beauty Bonanza With Jackie Kropp, Senior Editorial Director at Sephora
item.description:
Live from our Sayulita, Mexico vacation (complete with ambient jungle noise), our very first guest ep. We welcome BaubleBar alum and current Sephora Senior Editorial Director, Jackie Kropp, to answer all of our beauty questions. She schools us on the holy trinity of skincare ingredients, gives us some tough love on sunscreen (we're not using enough!!), and talks about her own struggle with hormonal acne.

Join us on August 8th for our next book club discussing All We Ever Wanted by Emily Giffin (she is one of our favorite authors!!) 

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

item.title: Ep 18: Listen To Your Heart Book Club. We picked a bad book. Oops. But also! A fun game, + how we started our podcast.
item.itunes:title: Ep 16: Listen To Your Heart Book Club. We picked a bad book. Oops. But also! A fun game, + how we started our podcast.
item.description:
This episode we're discussing Listen to Your Heart by Kasie West, which (so sorry) was actually awful. In this episode, we rip apart this book. We both hated it. (Seriously, so sorry!)

But, it's still a good episode. Becca made up a clever new game and we talk about how we started our podcast. But also, Grace's plans to get Becca married off just so that we have a wedding to look forward to, our mutual neon sign obsession, and much much more. Sorry for picking a terrible book but honestly, it is kind of fun talking about how bad this book is!

Join us on August 8th for our next book club discussing All We Ever Wanted by Emily Giffin (she is one of our favorite authors!!) In the meantime, don't forget to send us advice questions for next week!

 

Can't get enough Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

item.title: Ep 17: Advice - Self Care Is More Than Just Face Masks & Getting Over The Self-Care Guilt
item.itunes:title: Ep 17: Advice - Self Care Is More Than Just Face Masks & Getting Over The Self-Care Guilt
item.description:
This week, we're talking all about self care. And it's more than just face masks and baths! Sometimes self care is being your own parent and forcing yourself to do that thing you don't want to do. We're dishing on everything from our perfect self-care-day to self care on a budget to if you should feel guilty about taking time for yourself.

Please read this amazing article we referenced on self care!

Also Grace references this Yoga Nidra meditation.

In addition to everything self-care, we're also talking about our love languages, our summer travel plans, and our new summer uniforms!

Next book club: Join us on July 25th for our next book club discussing Listen to Your Heart by Kasie West.

item.itunes:title: Ep 16: A Million Junes Book Club. Becca's back in New York and We Talk about family drama and curses!
item.description:
This episode we're discussing A Million Junes by Emily Henry, which is basically a magical and modern version of Romeo & Juliet (without anyone dying). This book was so cute... we both really, really loved it!

We are also talking about some major highs and lows, Grace's time on Cape Cod with her family, our current obsessions (both beauty related!), family drama + curses, and lots more.

item.title: Ep 14: Social Creature Book Club, Grace's Trip To Asia, & Becca's Emotional Eating Tour
item.itunes:title: Ep 14: Social Creature Book Club, Grace's Trip To Asia, & Becca's Emotional Eating Tour
item.description:
This episode we're discussing Social Creature by Tara Isabella Burton, a Talented Mr. Ripley story for the digital age. After killing her best friend, the murderer keeps her victim alive through her social media presence.

Looking to avoid spoilers or just not into book eps? Book chat is 12:00 - 33:30.

We're also talking about Grace's trip to Asia (and subsequent jetlag — this week's obsession: Ambien!) and Becca's unexpected trip to Florida. Folks, Florida is certainly no Asia, but there is Chili's and Becca is emotionally eating her way through a family member's illness.

We've also read over 10 books since our last episode, so have lots of new reading recs!

Join us on July 11 for our next book club discussing A Million Junes by Emily Henry.

item.description:
It's our first listener's choice book club! You voted and we're discussing To All The Boys I've Loved Before by Jenny Han, a sweet high school rom com where the protagonist's love life goes from 0 to 60 when all her crushes accidentally receive secret love letters she wrote to them!

We're also wondering who is actually reading YA - adults or teens? Then, Grace shares her witch-approved ex-boyfriend healing ritual and we both chat unpopular shopping favorites (Lulu's for Becca, Talbot's for Grace). Plus tons more highs, lows, and recent reads!

Join us on June 27 for our first adult book pick: Social Creature by Tara Isabella Barton.

item.content:encoded:
In this advice ep, we're talking all things career. We've gotten a ton of questions around changing career paths and we answer that today (spoiler: We say, go for it!) We also talk about being your own advocate, and the fact that it's totally normal not to know what you want to do. Also, Grace's thoughts on Glossier (+shower gel obsession), and Becca's introverted extrovert struggles.

Join us next week for our next book club to discuss Famous in Love!

In the meantime, loving Bad on Paper?

item.title: Ep 7: Advice. Friendship Questions Galore, Becca's Big News, & Grace Goes To The Derby
item.itunes:title: Ep 7: Advice. Friendship Questions Galore, Becca's Big News, & Grace Goes To The Derby
item.description:
In this advice ep, we're talking all things friendship. Do you owe your friend a formal friendship breakup? How to keep old friends and make new ones when you're going through a major life change. And, should you talk about your salary with your close friends? (Spoiler, we think yes!) Becca also has some big news about her job and Grace is headed to the Kentucky Derby. Plus, Grace & Becca are taking a big trip (YA on the road anyone?).

Links mentioned: Mollie's article on leaving your job.

Join us next week for our next book club to discuss The Royal We in honor of the royal wedding.

In the meantime, loving Bad on Paper?

item.title: Ep 5: Advice. Instagram is not Real Life, Moving to a New City, The "Shame" of Bad Books.. + B&G Can't Stop Buying Shoes.
item.itunes:title: Ep 5: Advice. Instagram is not Real Life, Moving to a New City, The Shame of Bad Books, Becca & Grace Can't Stop Buying Shoes.
item.description:
It's Advice Day! Today, Grace & Becca answer a range of your questions - from not comparing yourself to others, to getting over the "shame" of reading bad books, making more time to read, moving to a new city, and more!

During the ep, G&B also discuss the fact that they can't stop buying shoes (Becca: M. Gemi; Grace: Loeffler Randall). Meanwhile, Grace has deleted all her dating apps and Becca can't stop following seltzer accounts on Instagram.

Join us next week for our next book club to discuss The Thousandth Floor by Katharine McGee.

In the meantime, loving Bad on Paper?

item.title: Ep 4: One Of Us Is Lying Book Club, Grace Got A Gravity Blanket, & Becca Figured Out Her Natural Beauty Routine
item.itunes:title: Ep 4: One Of Us Is Lying Book Club, Grace Got A Gravity Blanket, & Becca Figured Out Her Natural Beauty Routine
item.description:
Join Grace & Becca for their second book club discussing One Of Us Is Lying by Karen McManus. Think: The Breakfast Club meets Pretty Little Liars. This thriller really kept us guessing! During the ep, G&B also discuss the awfulness of hangovers in your 30's, Becca's new natural skincare routine, Grace's gravity blanket purchase, and whether you should re-read books you love.

Join us for our next book club in 2 weeks to discuss The Thousandth Floor by Katharine McGee.

Other books mentioned: 

Who's That Girl by Mhairi McFarlane

The Good Liar by Catharine McKenzie

In the meantime, loving Bad On Paper?

item.title: Ep 3: Advice. Passions, Promotions, + More.
item.itunes:title: Ep 3: Advice. Passions, Promotions, + More.
item.description:
It's our first advice session! This week, Grace & Becca are answering a few of your career related questions. The ladies discuss taking a passion project/hobby and turning it into a career, asking for a promotion or more money at work, what they would have done differently right after college, + more. Plus, they also chat about current self care favorites (do you have a gravity blanket yet??), their favorite instagram accounts right now, + the highs and lows of the week.

If you haven't already, pick up next week's book - One of Us is Lying. 

And if you have a question for a future episode, send us an email - youngadultingpod@gmail.com

In the meantime, loving Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

And leave us a review in iTunes!

item.title: Ep 2: The Selection Book Club
item.itunes:title: Ep 2: The Selection Book Club
item.description:
Our first book club is here!!! This week, Grace & Becca are discussing one of their fave young adult series, The Selection. Think The Bachelor meets The Hunger Games. The ladies discuss all the important topics: would you have entered the selection when you were 16? When was your childhood awkward phase? And team Aspen v. team Maxon. Plus, G & B discuss their fave workouts, their skincare obsessions, and which Instagram accounts they highly recommend you follow.

In the meantime, loving Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more

item.title: Ep 1: Introducing Bad on Paper Podcast
item.itunes:title: Ep 1: Introducing Bad On Paper Podcast
item.description:
Introducing Bad On Paper podcast. Meet Grace Atwood and Becca Freeman. Every Wednesday, the ladies will dish up a new episode alternating between book clubs on the best/worst in young adult fiction and taking reader questions, covering everything from finding the right career to picking the perfect face mask! We're so excited you're listening!

Join us next week for our first book club where we'll discuss a YA fave, The Selection.

In the meantime, loving Bad On Paper?

Join our FB group for amazing book recs & more
